commit_message:
Update the dependency in stable/newton branch

1. What is the problem
The Tricircle is one project in OpenStack name space, it runs with the
dependency to OpenStack services like Nova, Cinder, Neutron. In the
master branch of the Tricircle, all dependencies are pointed to the
master branch of all OpenStack services, include itself.

When the stable/newton branch of the Tricircle was created, all these
dependencies are not changed, for the master will change now and then,
then the stable/newton branch of the Tricircle will not be able to run
normally as more and more changes happen in the master branch, for
the Tricircle must be changed too to adapt the dependency change, but in
the stable/newton branch, we'll not cherry pick back all these changes
from master to the stable/newton branch.

2. What is the solution to the problem
When the Tricircle stable/newton branch is created, all these
dependencies should be pointed to stable/newton branch.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
   to realize the solution
No new feature is needed, just update the dependency.

Change-Id: I2c63c5026fbc3d1796f9b2a18a5476d575ae592f
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tricircle refs/changes/66/379966/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TRICIRCLE_BRANCH=${TRICIRCLE_BRANCH:-stable/newton}

commit_message:
Correct deleting of role assignments

If role assignment is already removed by any means
we do not want to send request to delete it in Heat.

Closes-Bug: #1615947
Change-Id: I15f542c0d5756356a5d5ac14a35704c07903e24b

commit_message:
[AMQP 1.0] Avoid unnecessary thread switch on ack

Avoid blocking the RPC Server thread when it attempts to acknowledge
the RPC request message.  Blocking is unnecessary as the acknowledge
command does not return a status and can be processed asynchronously
from the server thread.

Avoiding this context switch improves overall RPC call throughput
according to the simulator tool by approximately ten percent on my
test systems.

Change-Id: I71548eb6f9f7dcaf74cb426d4e9b369b54856419

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/82/385582/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Cleanup pip.conf file ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Upgrade hosts ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Before installing the infrastructure and OpenStack, update the host machines. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible setup-hosts.yml --limit '!galera_all' This command is the same as doing host setups on a new install. The ``galera_all`` host group is excluded to prevent reconfiguration and restarting of any Galera containers. Update Galera LXC container configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Update the Galera container configuration independently. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible lxc-containers-create.yml -e \ 'lxc_container_allow_restarts=false' --limit galera_all This command is a subset of the host setup playbook, limited to the ``galera_all`` host group. The configuration of those containers will be updated but a restart for any changes to take effect will be deferred to a later playbook. Perform a controlled rolling restart of the galera containers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Restart containers one at a time, ensuring that each is up, responding, and synced with the other nodes in the cluster, before moving on to the next. This step allows the lxc container config applied earlier to take effect, ensuring that the containers are restarted in a controlled fashion. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible "${UPGRADE_PLAYBOOKS}/galera-cluster-rolling-restart.yml" Update HAProxy configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Install and update any new or changed HAProxy service configurations. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible haproxy-install.yml Update repo servers ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Update the configuration of the repo servers and build new packages required by the |current_release_formal_name| release. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible repo-install.yml Perform a mariadb version upgrade ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Update mariadb to the most 10.0 minor release across the cluster. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible galera-install.yml -e 'galera_upgrade=true' The following commands perform all steps from the setup-infrastructure playbook, except for `repo-install.yml``, ``haproxyinstall.yml``, and `galera-install.yml`` which we ran earlier. Running these playbook applies the relevant |current_release_formal_name| settings and packages. # openstack-ansible memcached-install.yml # openstack-ansible rabbitmq-install.yml -e 'rabbitmq_upgrade=true' # openstack-ansible utility-install.yml # openstack-ansible rsyslog-install.yml
deleted_lines: `````````````````````````````````````Upgrade hosts ~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Before installing the infrastructure and OpenStack, update the host machines. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible setup-hosts.yml --limit '!galera_all[0]' This command is the same as doing host setups on a new install. The first member of the ``galera_all`` host group is excluded to prevent simultaneous restarts of all Galera containers. Update Galera LXC container configuration ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Update the first Galera container's configuration independently. .. code-block:: console # openstack-ansible lxc-containers-create.yml --limit galera_all[0] This command is a subset of the host setup playbook, limited to the first member of the ``galera_all`` host group so that its container is restarted only after other Galera containers have been restarted in the previous step. Cleanup ``pip.conf`` file ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Running the standard OpenStack-Ansible infrastructure playbook applies the relevant |current_release_formal_name| settings and packages.This upgrade is required for the |current_release_formal_name| release of OpenStack-Ansible. # openstack-ansible setup-infrastructure.yml -e 'galera_upgrade=true' \ -e 'rabbitmq_upgrade=true'

commit_message:
Skip cinder-related scenarios when cinder is not available

We already check for some features to be enabled, but we forget the
obvious one; and we know the scenario will just fail.

Change-Id: Ia795f29c7bad0fde9f2c8356fb2cb65cb815abd9

commit_message:
Tagging solum artifacts in preparation to cut newton branch

These commits are good to go as stable/newton branches

commit_message:
Require WebOb>=1.6.0

Nova change 4e923eb9a660593b8a7d2522992700182978a54c started
using the json_formatter kwarg which was introduced in WebOb
1.6.0:

https://github.com/Pylons/webob/commit/87c8749a57c1ff2442db2d74d9fb86935b7b201e

So we need to raise the minimum required version for nova to use.

Change-Id: Ia778a11afb03b6d4b57dbd55a801a5a28b10541d
Depends-On: I2bbad0c059cc514ba0be1d42c061056a342caadc
Closes-Bug: #1632723
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/99/385499/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: WebOb>=1.6.0 # MIT

commit_message:
Modify use of assertTrue(A in B)

Use assertIn(A, B) instead of assertTrue(A in B)

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ia186e0010e3b7f5ea1103cde990bd8a8be695361

The http_proxy_to_wsgi was recently added, however, in order to have

Change-Id: I6b5bffe3e69e05a612bf4097b85d156b4a768356

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to config-generator

The http_proxy_to_wsgi was recently added, however, in order to have
this configuration added by the config generator, we need to add it
to that relevant conf file.

Change-Id: I6b5bffe3e69e05a612bf4097b85d156b4a768356
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/60/385760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: namespace = oslo.middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi

subject: Add scenarios from Neutron to multinode dvr full job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-15 07:26:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/dcfa9d3912980580dcb942a53adc525aae1f5500', 'message': "Replace DVR multinode full nv job with DVR scenario tests

Currently we don't have any job that triggers scenario tests from
Neutron tree.  This patch replaces full DVR multinode job with a job that
runs scenario tests from tempest tree and scenario tests from Neutron
tree.

Tempest full job runs api tests against projects that don't rely on DVR
configuration so they only consumed resources.  So far, this job is
non-voting.

Change-Id: If5e3722c62b470c62b547444c9a1f5938f1c0667
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-15 13:46:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/56938f3dfc8de1e5a11dd522320b7f854f314dd4', 'message': "Add scenarios from Neutron to multinode dvr full job

Neutron tree.  This patch adds existing scenarios from Neutron tree to
full suite.  The job is currently non-voting.

"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-28 15:45:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/70972683bb30a6bebc3d6ccbb9e38b6aa570444d', 'message': "Add scenarios from Neutron to multinode dvr full job

commit_message:
Add scenarios from Neutron to multinode dvr full job

Currently we don't have any job that triggers dvr multinode scenario
tests from Neutron tree. This patch adds introduces such a job for
Neutron experimental queue.

Change-Id: If5e3722c62b470c62b547444c9a1f5938f1c0667
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/44/355344/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-scenario-neutron-dvr-multinode{job-suffix}' export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_ALL_PLUGINS=1 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_REGEX="^(neutron\.tests\.tempest\.scenario\.|tempest\.scenario\.)"
deleted_lines: name: '{pipeline}-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr-multinode-full{job-suffix}' export DEVSTACK_GATE_CONFIGDRIVE=0 export DEVSTACK_GATE_TEMPEST_FULL=1 # Test DVR works multinode

commit_message:
Allow versioned containers

Allow users to create versioned containers.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/overview_object_versioning.html

Change-Id: Ia967897af15465aa6c1318c0bdeaa2233c605cac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/55/384955/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: swift::storage::all::allow_versions: true

name: /^(primary-)?(database|rabbitmq)$/ parameters: cmd: crm node maintenance timeout: 120 - id: hiera_default_route type: puppet version: 2.1.0 groups: [primary-controller, controller, cinder, cinder-block-device, cinder-vmware, compute, compute-vmware, ceph-osd, primary-mongo, mongo, virt, ironic] # We need to execute this task before netconfig on all nodes except mongo. # Mongo nodes will configure routing via admin network and update it later # with configure_default_route task cross-depended-by: yaql_exp: > switch( ( ('mongo' in $.roles) or ('primary-mongo' in $.roles) ) => [ {name=>'configure_default_route',role=>'self'} ], true => [ {name=>'netconfig',role=>'self'} ] ) # On mongo nodes this task should be executed after netconfig in order # to not break default route by setting it to not yet existent mgmt VIP cross-depends: yaql_exp: > switch( ( ('mongo' in $.roles) or ('primary-mongo' in $.roles) ) => [ {name=>'netconfig',role=>'self'}, {name=>'post_deployment_start',role=>'self'} ], true => [ {name=>'tools',role=>'self'} ] ) condition: yaql_exp: &network > changedAny($.network_scheme, $.get('dpdk'), $.get('use_ovs'), $.get('set_rps'), $.get('run_ping_checker'), $.network_scheme.endpoints.values().where( $.get('gateway') != null).gateway, $.network_metadata.vips) parameters: puppet_manifest: /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig/hiera_default_route.pp puppet_modules: /etc/puppet/modules timeout: 120 - id: netconfig type: puppet version: 2.1.0 groups: [primary-controller, controller, cinder, cinder-block-device, cinder-vmware, compute, ceph-osd, primary-mongo, mongo, virt, ironic] required_for: [deploy_end] requires: [tools] condition: yaql_exp: *network parameters: puppet_manifest: /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig/netconfig.pp puppet_modules: /etc/puppet/modules timeout: 300 test_pre: cmd: ruby /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig/netconfig_pre.rb test_post: cmd: ruby /etc/puppet/modules/osnailyfacter/modular/netconfig/netconfig_post.rb # Run netconfig task on all nodes (except mongo and vrouter VIP roles) after virtual_ips. # Thus we make sure that our default gateway (vrouter VIP) is up before configuring # routing on nodes. cross-depends: yaql_exp: > switch( ( $.roles.any($.matches('^(primary-)?(mongo)$')) or ($.network_metadata.get('vips',{}).get('vrouter',{}).get('ipaddr') = null) or ( len($.roles.toSet().intersect($.network_metadata.get('vips',{}).get('vrouter',{}).get('node_roles').toSet())) > 0 ) ) => [], true => [{ name => 'virtual_ips', role => $.network_metadata.get('vips',{}).get('vrouter',{}).get('node_roles') }] ) - commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I204009ec49068f992cee89a5f721684512959f1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep refs/changes/21/383321/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # -- Options for Internationalization output ------------------------------ locale_dirs = ['locale/']

subject: Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 04:39:53.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_analytics/banana/grammar/base_ast.py', 'monasca_analytics/banana/grammar/ast.py', 'monasca_analytics/ldp/monasca_combine.py', 'monasca_analytics/ldp/monasca_derivative.py', 'test/ldp/test_monasca_aggregator.py', 'monasca_analytics/banana/grammar/config.py', 'monasca_analytics/ldp/monasca_aggregate.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-analytics/commit/05f12bfffae6a62ecf2fa119e691472276777c1e', 'message': "Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: I5233438a864bb00d04ba7fb2b1688cacb0473691
"}]
commit_message:
Remove xrange for run both Python 2 and Python 3

In python 3, range() does what xrange() used to do and xrange() does not
exist. If you want to write code that will run on both Python 2 and
Python 3, you can't use xrange().

range() can actually be faster in some cases - eg. if iterating over the
same sequence multiple times. xrange() has to reconstruct the integer
object every time, but range() will have real integer objects.
(It will always perform worse in terms of memory however)

xrange() isn't usable in all cases where a real list is needed.
For instance, it doesn't support slices, or any list methods.

Change-Id: I5233438a864bb00d04ba7fb2b1688cacb0473691
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-analytics refs/changes/65/385265/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: for index in range(0, len(separated_metrics[0])): for metric_index in range(1, metric_count):
deleted_lines: for index in xrange(0, len(separated_metrics[0])): for metric_index in xrange(1, metric_count):

commit_message:
Adjust help text of config option rabbit_max_retries

The annotation the link of
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/b0947e57138b97ef18f1451aa900bd476490e502/oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py#L684
shows that if rabbit_max_retries = 0, there is no retry
to connect to rabbitmq after disconnection.

In the kombu lib, this two links https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/d9340c1f3b6660c596ee35eba943336e91eb5dd8/kombu/connection.py#L356
and https://github.com/celery/kombu/blob/85c191a48ace265836bbce39a2c8a5fab98833b8/kombu/utils/functional.py#L331
prove it.

Change-Id: I11811f9f04a9615d226fc2e24a4078a9618f766f

commit_message:
Relocate router route DB model

As there would be issue of cyclic imports while implementation of
objects for router route  which has db models definition and mixins
in same file, this patch will refactor router route models.

Change-Id: I6b71ab19cc7184ecbcde8808b95ef838379f0a39
Co-Authored-By: Victor Morales <victor.morales@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/354797/27 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import sqlalchemy as sa from sqlalchemy import orm from neutron.db import l3_db from neutron.db import model_base from neutron.db import models_v2 class RouterRoute(model_base.BASEV2, models_v2.Route): router_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), sa.ForeignKey('routers.id', ondelete="CASCADE"), primary_key=True) router = orm.relationship(l3_db.Router, backref=orm.backref("route_list", lazy='joined', cascade='delete'))

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 08:17:59.000000000', 'files': ['etc/panko/api_paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/panko/commit/6312c8e7b4bf2dd0afbeb19819779b78ddf3e942', 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 90faa85ecc6cc4e6875c5cb14285f20104830b69)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 90faa85ecc6cc4e6875c5cb14285f20104830b69)

subject: Use 'uuid' if 'id' is not found in '_source'
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-07 18:39:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-searchlightclient/commit/8ea265e41e498f39d97abf7aa6bad74f9581eb6f', 'message': "Fall back to '_id' value if 'id' is not found in '_source'

Searchlight plugin API allows to use any name for document id field,
it's 'uuid' in ironic for example. But due to limitation in client
code only 'id' can be used. This patch proposes leave '_id' field
as is if 'id' is not found in '_source'.

Closes-Bug: #1621199
Change-Id: Icf0bdb72f790029e08be1150c4f7352446b1d8b2

"}]
commit_message:
Use 'uuid' if 'id' is not found in '_source'

OpenStack ironic service does not have 'id' field in the external
representation of resources. If 'id' is not present try to use
'uuid'.

Partial-Bug: #1621199
Change-Id: Icf0bdb72f790029e08be1150c4f7352446b1d8b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-searchlightclient refs/changes/03/366903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestChangeID(TestSearch): def _test_change_id(self, new_id=None): cmd = search.SearchResource(self.app, None) fake_data = copy.deepcopy(searchlight_fakes.Resource) doc_0 = fake_data['hits']['hits'][0] if new_id is not None: doc_0['_source']['id'] = new_id assert_id = new_id else: doc_0['_source']['uuid'] = doc_0['_source'].pop('id') assert_id = doc_0['_id'] self.search_client.search.return_value = \ fakes.FakeResource(None, fake_data, loaded=True) parsed_args = self.check_parser(cmd, ['name: fake', '--source'], []) columns, data = cmd.take_action(parsed_args) ret_id = data[0][0] self.assertEqual(assert_id, ret_id) def test__id_not_changed(self): self._test_change_id() def test__id_changed(self): self._test_change_id(new_id='id_123')

This will not produce a false positive. Add networking-sfc port-chain resource plug-in

This patch adds below networking-sfc resource

OS::Neutron::PortChain

blueprint : sfc-heat

Change-Id: I2283e40ac4b562ff2d8780ea403a397073c2a82b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/40/277940/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2016 Huawei Technologies India Pvt Ltd # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import six from neutronclient.common import exceptions from neutronclient.v2_0 import client as neutronclient from heat.common import exception from heat.common import template_format from heat.engine.clients.os import neutron from heat.engine.resources.openstack.neutron.sfc import port_chain from heat.engine import scheduler from heat.tests import common from heat.tests import utils port_chain_template = ''' heat_template_version: 2015-04-30 description: Template to test networking-sfc port chain resource resources: port_chain: type: OS::Neutron::PortChain properties: name: test_port_chain description : port_chain_desc port_pair_groups: - port_pair_group_1 - port_pair_group_2 flow_classifiers: - flow_classifier1 - flow_classifier2 chain_parameters: {"correlation" :'mpls'} ''' PC_PATH = "/sfc/port_chains" class PortChain(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(PortChain, self).setUp() self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'create_ext') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'delete_ext') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'show_ext') self.m.StubOutWithMock(neutronclient.Client, 'update_ext') self.patchobject(neutron.NeutronClientPlugin, 'has_extension', return_value=True) def test_resource_mapping(self): mapping = port_chain.resource_mapping() self.assertEqual(port_chain.PortChain, mapping['OS::Neutron::PortChain']) def create_portchain(self): neutronclient.Client.create_ext(PC_PATH, { 'port_chain': {'name': 'test_port_chain', 'description': 'port_chain_desc', 'port_pair_groups': ['port_pair_group_1', 'port_pair_group_2'], 'flow_classifiers': ['flow_classifier1', 'flow_classifier2'], 'chain_parameters': {"correlation": 'mpls'}}} ).AndReturn({'port_chain': {'id': '7678'}}) snippet = template_format.parse(port_chain_template) self.stack = utils.parse_stack(snippet) resource_defns = self.stack.t.resource_definitions(self.stack) return port_chain.PortChain( 'port_chain', resource_defns['port_chain'], self.stack) def test_create(self): rsrc = self.create_portchain() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_create_failed(self): neutronclient.Client.create_ext(PC_PATH, { 'port_chain': {'name': 'test_port_chain', 'description': 'port_chain_desc', 'port_pair_groups': ['port_pair_group_1', 'port_pair_group_2'], 'flow_classifiers': ['flow_classifier1', 'flow_classifier2'], 'chain_parameters': {"correlation": 'mpls'}}} ).AndRaise(exceptions.NeutronClientException()) self.m.ReplayAll() snippet = template_format.parse(port_chain_template) stack = utils.parse_stack(snippet) resource_defns = stack.t.resource_definitions(stack) rsrc = port_chain.PortChain( 'port_chain', resource_defns['port_chain'], stack) error = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)) self.assertEqual( 'NeutronClientException: resources.port_chain: ' 'An unknown exception occurred.', six.text_type(error)) self.assertEqual((rsrc.CREATE, rsrc.FAILED), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_delete(self): neutronclient.Client.delete_ext(PC_PATH + '/%s', '7678') neutronclient.Client.show_ext(PC_PATH + '/%s', '7678').AndRaise( exceptions.NeutronClientException(status_code=404)) rsrc = self.create_portchain() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)() self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.COMPLETE), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_delete_failed(self): neutronclient.Client.delete_ext(PC_PATH + '/%s', '7678').AndRaise( exceptions.NeutronClientException(status_code=400)) rsrc = self.create_portchain() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() error = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.delete)) self.assertEqual( 'NeutronClientException: resources.port_chain: ' 'An unknown exception occurred.', six.text_type(error)) self.assertEqual((rsrc.DELETE, rsrc.FAILED), rsrc.state) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_attribute_failed(self): rsrc = self.create_portchain() self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() error = self.assertRaises(exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute, rsrc.FnGetAtt, 'subnet_id') self.assertEqual( 'The Referenced Attribute (port_chain subnet_id) is ' 'incorrect.', six.text_type(error)) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_update_name(self): rsrc = self.create_portchain() neutronclient.Client.update_ext(PC_PATH + '/%s', '7678', {'port_chain': {'name': 'test_portchain2'}} ).AndReturn({'port_chain': {'id': '7678'}}) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() update_template = copy.deepcopy(rsrc.t) update_template['Properties']['name'] = 'test_portchain2' scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.update, update_template)() self.m.VerifyAll() def test_update_description(self): rsrc = self.create_portchain() neutronclient.Client.update_ext(PC_PATH + '/%s', '7678', {'port_chain': {'description': 'Test_desc'}} ).AndReturn({'port_chain': {'id': '7678'}}) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() update_template = copy.deepcopy(rsrc.t) update_template['Properties']['description'] = 'Test_desc' scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.update, update_template)() self.m.VerifyAll() def test_update_flow_classifier(self): rsrc = self.create_portchain() neutronclient.Client.update_ext(PC_PATH + '/%s', '7678', {'port_chain': {'flow_classifiers': ['flow3', 'flow4']}} ).AndReturn({'port_chain': {'id': '7678'}}) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.create)() update_template = copy.deepcopy(rsrc.t) update_template['Properties']['flow_classifiers'] = ['flow3', 'flow4'] scheduler.TaskRunner(rsrc.update, update_template)() self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Fix help string for osc resource show <resource>

Currently help string of <resource> tells "Name or ID of resource" which
is wrong - resource-show doesn't accepts ID's of resources.

Change-Id: I8b8f6c937e1119c90c0ef473c3784c0523593481
Related-bug: #1620291
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-heatclient refs/changes/79/385479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: help=_('Name of resource')

commit_message:
Fix js validation of the password in dynamic UI

Before this patch clicking on an eye icon disabled javascript
validation of the password. I added to password field
the attribute 'data-type=password' and in js changed
the selector to include new attribute in the selector,
that attaches the check function.

Change-Id: Ic7e57814a68c315e570c120f31febdada73079a7
Closes-Bug: #1567859

commit_message:
Use sys.maxsize instead of sys.maxint

The sys.maxint constant was removed in python 3 and now it's
better to use sys.maxsize.
https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.0.html#integers

Change-Id: I5af1537ae04a16454f20040e01ec64a6454171a2
Closes-Bug: #1628830
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/85/379285/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: translated.get('minLength', -sys.maxsize - 1), translated.get('maxLength', sys.maxsize),

subject: Support multi arch deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-30 05:26:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/5fe0619926ea2761696d9262ffac5ef7daf7c73d', 'message': 'Support multi arch deployment

Ironic is flexible for x86/x86_64 servers by supporting BIOS and UEFI.
But to deploy servers of other architectures, such as aarch64 or ppc64,
configuration(PXE boot file and config template) must be modified,
which means one Ironic node can only deploy baremetal machines of one
architecture.

This patch adds multi arch deployment support. For example, to deploy
x86_64 and aarch64 servers by one Ironic node.

Closes-Bug: #1582964

Change-Id: I628320aeb44b232a262d0843bc726a68d297e1f8
Signed-off-by: Yibo Cai <yibo.cai@linaro.org>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-31 01:53:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/9ff7b9776f89457c61822828850f258f6eb82dc9', 'message': 'Support multi arch deployment

Ironic is flexible for x86/x86_64 servers by supporting BIOS and UEFI.
But to deploy servers of other architectures, such as aarch64 or ppc64,
configuration(PXE boot file and config template) must be modified,
which means one Ironic node can only deploy baremetal machines of one
architecture.

This patch adds multi arch deployment support. For example, to deploy
x86_64 and aarch64 servers by one Ironic node.

Closes-Bug: #1582964

Change-Id: I628320aeb44b232a262d0843bc726a68d297e1f8
Signed-off-by: Yibo Cai <yibo.cai@linaro.org>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-01 02:34:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/05d49c1bdd24b4d19857e76d35a370cc1c7eaef4', 'message': 'Support multi arch deployment

Ironic is flexible for x86/x86_64 servers by supporting BIOS and UEFI.
But to deploy servers of other architectures, such as aarch64 or ppc64,
configuration(PXE boot file and config template) must be modified,
which means one Ironic node can only deploy baremetal machines of one
architecture.

This patch adds multi arch deployment support. For example, to deploy
x86_64 and aarch64 servers by one Ironic node.

Closes-Bug: #1582964

commit_message:
Support multi arch deployment

Ironic is flexible for x86/x86_64 servers by supporting BIOS and UEFI.
But to deploy servers of other architectures, such as aarch64 or ppc64,
configuration(PXE boot file and config template) must be modified,
which means one Ironic conductor can only deploy baremetal machines of
one architecture.

This patch adds multi arch deployment support. For example, to deploy
x86_64 and aarch64 servers by one Ironic conductor.

Closes-Bug: #1582964

Change-Id: I628320aeb44b232a262d0843bc726a68d297e1f8

added_lines: class GetPxeBootConfigTestCase(db_base.DbTestCase): def setUp(self): super(GetPxeBootConfigTestCase, self).setUp() self.node = obj_utils.get_test_node(self.context, driver='fake') self.config(pxe_bootfile_name='bios-bootfile', group='pxe') self.config(uefi_pxe_bootfile_name='uefi-bootfile', group='pxe') self.config(pxe_config_template='bios-template', group='pxe') self.config(uefi_pxe_config_template='uefi-template', group='pxe') def test_get_pxe_boot_config_none(self): self.node.properties = {} self.config(pxe_bootfile_name_by_arch={}, group='pxe') self.config(pxe_config_template_by_arch={}, group='pxe') result = utils.get_pxe_boot_file(self.node) self.assertEqual('bios-bootfile', result) result = utils.get_pxe_config_template(self.node) self.assertEqual('bios-template', result) def test_get_pxe_boot_config_default_no_arch(self): properties = {'cpu_arch': 'x86_64', 'capabilities': 'boot_mode:uefi'} self.node.properties = properties self.config(pxe_bootfile_name_by_arch={}, group='pxe') self.config(pxe_config_template_by_arch={}, group='pxe') result = utils.get_pxe_boot_file(self.node) self.assertEqual('uefi-bootfile', result) result = utils.get_pxe_config_template(self.node) self.assertEqual('uefi-template', result) def test_get_pxe_boot_config_default_with_arch(self): properties = {'cpu_arch': 'x86_64', 'capabilities': 'boot_mode:bios'} bootfile_by_arch = {'aarch64': 'aarch64-bootfile', 'ppc64': 'ppc64-bootfile'} template_by_arch = {'aarch64': 'aarch64-template', 'ppc64': 'ppc64-template'} self.node.properties = properties self.config(pxe_bootfile_name_by_arch=bootfile_by_arch, group='pxe') self.config(pxe_config_template_by_arch=template_by_arch, group='pxe') result = utils.get_pxe_boot_file(self.node) self.assertEqual('bios-bootfile', result) result = utils.get_pxe_config_template(self.node) self.assertEqual('bios-template', result) def test_get_pxe_boot_config_by_arch(self): properties = {'cpu_arch': 'aarch64'} bootfile_by_arch = {'aarch64': 'aarch64-bootfile', 'ppc64': 'ppc64-bootfile'} template_by_arch = {'aarch64': 'aarch64-template', 'ppc64': 'ppc64-template'} self.node.properties = properties self.config(pxe_bootfile_name_by_arch=bootfile_by_arch, group='pxe') self.config(pxe_config_template_by_arch=template_by_arch, group='pxe') result = utils.get_pxe_boot_file(self.node) self.assertEqual('aarch64-bootfile', result) result = utils.get_pxe_config_template(self.node) self.assertEqual('aarch64-template', result)

This also includes an update per [1].

commit_message:
Downloads templates from swift before processing update

There is an issue with update that the templates files need
to be downloaded before being sent to heat. This solves the issue
on the update side.

Change-Id: I8aa6262716534dec7b51e64f491d7131c359f802
Depends-On: Ib644185f2459e1705267a4114d97cf077ebfa884
Closes-Bug: #1626128
(cherry picked from commit c7a1b84e713afd59630261d6f3992a4f798504a1)

commit_message:
Use the right wait_until_true function from neutron

Neutron moves the function to another module and the old
one will be removed in Ocata.

Change-Id: I4fad5aa9bdcbb7e04578d387a1bbfb7ed3edcb6b

subject: Fix dockerctl backup logic to remove double pausing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-18 12:58:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/b26200a708da7f7df63b14b6e475a1620a82160d', 'message': 'Fix dockerctl backup logic to remove double pausing

This commit changes logic of pausing containers to prevent trying
to pause already paused containers.
If container was running before backup it will be paused and than unpaused.
If container was paused before backup it will stay paused after backup.

Change-Id: I78f428660366932b34002cd9985be79df8162c38
Closes-Bug: #1603842
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-22 14:50:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library/commit/6c374db7504ac447165f104c559a325673e01d00', 'message': 'Fix dockerctl backup logic to remove double pausing

This commit changes logic of pausing containers to prevent trying
to pause already paused containers.
If container was running before backup it will be paused and than unpaused.
If container was paused before backup it will stay paused after backup.

commit_message:
Fix dockerctl backup logic to remove double pausing

This commit changes logic of pausing containers to prevent trying
to pause already paused containers.
If container was running before backup it will be paused and than unpaused.
If container was paused before backup it will stay paused after backup.

Change-Id: I78f428660366932b34002cd9985be79df8162c38
Closes-Bug: #1603842
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/88/357188/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: local running=$(${DOCKER} ps -q --filter=status=running) local alreadypaused=$(${DOCKER} ps -q --filter=status=paused) for i in ${running}; do ${DOCKER} pause $i; done; echo "Unpausing previously paused containers..." for i in ${running}; do ${DOCKER} unpause $i; done; if [[ -n ${alreadypaused} ]]; then echo "NOTE: Following containers was not unpaused because they were paused before backup" echo ${alreadypaused} fi
deleted_lines: ${DOCKER} ps -q | xargs -n1 --no-run-if-empty ${DOCKER} pause echo "Unpausing containers..." ${DOCKER} ps -a | grep Paused | cut -d' ' -f1 | xargs -n1 --no-run-if-empty ${DOCKER} unpause

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 06:02:34.000000000', 'files': ['etc/aodh/api_paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/aodh/commit/3aeca07675a39ed12d0f224e71352faf03269bd8', 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Aodh. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Aodh.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 0f2a80d8efb86faea7ee94d7eb744bb66ad79ba9)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Aodh. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Aodh.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: If2ada8a94c8e1ceacd4509605b4cd766a78f71d5
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 0f2a80d8efb86faea7ee94d7eb744bb66ad79ba9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/67/385767/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pipeline = cors http_proxy_to_wsgi request_id authtoken api-serveroslo_config_project = aodh [filter:http_proxy_to_wsgi] paste.filter_factory = oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory oslo_config_project = aodh
deleted_lines: pipeline = cors request_id authtoken api-serveroslo_config_project = aodh

Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Ceilometer. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Ceilometer.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Ceilometer, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: I24f16dda49bd9e7930ca9f0d32bf0793463aff03
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 30eb0f0ae16c7ffd0f90c3874d3cbc462d5863a0)

commit_message:
tests: fix broken udp tests

test_udp_receive_bad_decoding was not asserting on anything to check
the deconding.

This change fixes that.

commit_message:
Server socket SO_REUSEPORT option

From linux kernel >= 3.9, it supports the SO_REUSEPORT option that will
allow multiple server socket to listen the same port.

Change-Id: I07aa5aefbbbf9c5335f4404509f5708cd2939b5d

commit_message:
Moved Watcher doc plugin outside main package

In this changeset, I renamed watcher/doc.py file as
doc/ext/term.py which subsequently does not get scanned for coverage
anymore. Hence, we can close this bug.

Change-Id: I9d700da6569b464ce71085fe78002521555002b9
Closes-bug: #1527163

commit_message:
Use ryu to parse error message

Given the comment in [1], ryu can be used to parse some OFPErrorMsg.
DF can use it. Since the error message is redundant, it is OK to just
parse some of the error message. An example output is at [2]

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/376218/
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/585267/

Change-Id: I57e43c0d0de7da28f030758f4917e0142c5fd889
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/11/384811/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from ryu.ofproto import ofproto_common from ryu.ofproto import ofproto_parser try: (version, msg_type, msg_len, xid) = ofproto_parser.header(msg.data) ryu_msg = ofproto_parser.msg( self._datapath, version, msg_type, msg_len - ofproto_common.OFP_HEADER_SIZE, xid, msg.data) LOG.error(_LE('OFPErrorMsg received: %s'), ryu_msg) except Exception: LOG.error(_LE('Unrecognized OFPErrorMsg received: ' 'type=0x%(type)02x code=0x%(code)02x ' 'message=%(msg)s'), {'type': msg.type, 'code': msg.code, 'msg': utils.hex_array(msg.data)})
deleted_lines: LOG.error(_LE('OFPErrorMsg received: type=0x%(type)02x ' 'code=0x%(code)02x message=%(msg)s'), {'type': msg.type, 'code': msg.code, 'msg': utils.hex_array(msg.data)})

commit_message:
Skip CentOS7 jobs for OSA OpenStack service repositories

Skip any OpenStack-Ansible jobs for os_ repositories which run on
CentOS7 except os_keystone, os_glance, os_cinder for stable/newton.

CentOS7 support is ongoing. While many repositories have CentOS7
support and jobs to validate this, we need to skip these jobs for
most of the OpenStack (ie os_*) repositories as they do not yet have
the supporting code in stable/newton but are gaining it in master.

Change-Id: I7f74834fd87ed07fcec86bf9dec2ea20ea5c5b48
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/34/385334/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Skip any OpenStack-Ansible jobs for os_ repositories which run on CentOS7 # except os_keystone, os_glance, os_cinder for stable/newton. - name: ^gate-openstack-ansible-os_(?!(keystone|glance|cinder)).*-ansible-.*-centos-7.*$ branch: ^(?!(liberty|stable/(mitaka|newton))).*$

commit_message:
Make Cinder multinode grenade job voting

In order for Cinder to achieve assert:supports-rolling-upgrade tag, we
need a voting job that's testing version compatibility. This commit
switches Cinder's multinode grenade job to voting.

Change-Id: If55890b97056762e4d5b3f850b3971b30dd96662

commit_message:
Add Juju Charms for PLUMgrid

PLUMgrid Juju Charms are used to deploy PLUMgrid Open Networking Suite
alongside OpenStack.

It requested that the charms be moved to the OpenStack infrastucture.

Change-Id: I8608617c2e3efee760f15b712b89266b611bdb34
Signed-off-by: Bilal Baqar <bbaqar@plumgrid.com>

commit_message:
Refactoring of keystone_user, keystone_user_role providers

When domain_specific_drivers are enabled in keystone
'--domain' option is mandatory when requesting 'user list'

Change-Id: Ib4aea37ed7be05a4d8654d8ef08dc9405bd649d1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/56/276356/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: request('domain', 'list').each do |domain| request('user', 'list', ['--long', '--domain', domain[:id]]).each do |user| domname = domain[:name] if instance_hash.include?(user[:name]) # not unique # user[:domain] is really the domain_id curdomid = instance_hash[user[:name]][:domain] if curdomid != default_domain_id # Move the user from the short name slot to the long name slot # because it is not in the default domain. curdomname = domain_name_from_id(curdomid) instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{curdomname}"] = instance_hash[user[:name]] # Use the short name slot for the new user instance_hash[user[:name]] = user else # Use the long name for the new user instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{domname}"] = user end # Unique (for now) - store in short name slot instance_hash[user[:name]] = user
deleted_lines: request('user', 'list', ['--long']).each do |user| # The field says "domain" but it is really the domain_id domname = domain_name_from_id(user[:domain]) if instance_hash.include?(user[:name]) # not unique curdomid = instance_hash[user[:name]][:domain] if curdomid != default_domain_id # Move the user from the short name slot to the long name slot # because it is not in the default domain. curdomname = domain_name_from_id(curdomid) instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{curdomname}"] = instance_hash[user[:name]] # Use the short name slot for the new user instance_hash[user[:name]] = user # Use the long name for the new user instance_hash["#{user[:name]}::#{domname}"] = user else # Unique (for now) - store in short name slot instance_hash[user[:name]] = user

commit_message:
Updates for switch to reactive charm model

tempest, openvswitch-odl and neutron-api-odl charms have switched to
using reactive and charm layers; update job definitions inline with
other reactive charms to ensure that python3 tests are executed.

Drop all python34-jobs entries from zuul layout as these are no
longer executed.

Change-Id: Ia42e75f9533971cd0b104d4a8cb37aebaf51b94d

commit_message:
Retire some wrong deb-os-* and deb-oslo*

These repositories are duplicate of deb-python-* (which matches the
source package name uploaded to Debian). They were wrongly added to
packaging-deb.

This patch is the intial step to remove the packages as per the
instructions at http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html.

Our appologies for the time loss with this.

Change-Id: Ie5dab06b847490340669bdd09c494f09a8e81e87

commit_message:
Enable release notes translation

Releasenote translation publishing is being prepared. 'locale_dirs'
needs to be defined in conf.py to generate translated version of the
release notes.

Note that this repository might not get translated release notes - or
no translations at all - but we add the entry here nevertheless to
prepare for it.

Change-Id: I555a492f92bf46e16206cc54b6d59c63be7cb1f8

commit_message:
Fix sahara gate: failure in tempest config options access

As Tempest removed the Sahara tests which are available in
sahara tempest plugin, CONF.data_processing attr is not
available to access the configuration options needed
for sahara tempest tests.

Plugin should set the whatever attribute they would like to access
their registered config options.

Tempest plugin framework do register all options and its upto
plugin how they like to access the config options.

Change-Id: I363ed9a3e0c4d45b04dc3b71bf1b0a21e7668584
Closes-Bug: #1632895
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-tests refs/changes/01/385701/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: config.CONF.data_processing = conf['data-processing']

commit_message:
Test: make enforce_type=True in conf.set_override

Each config option has limitation for type and value.
In production code, oslo.conf can ensure user's input
is valid, but in unit test, test methods can pass if
we use method conf.set_override without parameter
enforce_type=True even we pass wrong type or wrong
value to config option. This commit makes sure calling
method conf.set_override with enforce_type=True.

Change-Id: Ie45841737384453e716260381b60478490df4dfb
Closes-Bug: #1517839

commit_message:
tests: fix tests for functional tests without dsvm

Currently functional tests pass in gate just because some calls are
done on real devstack, and passed by chance. We don't need dsvm at all
with pifpaf.

This change fixes this tests and add bindep.txt file for new gate jobs
without dsvm will be setup to ensure this doesn't happen again.

The tox targets pyXX-psql are renamed pyXX-postgresql to match all other jobs names.

Change-Id: I0e6cfb71cc53a47a11a12b5797fe262f9211ce22

promote trove scenario tests for pxc and postgresql to voting

and (soon to be history) trove-integration repositories.

commit_message:
Fix container log bind mount regression

The container bind mount for all logs was being skipped due to a logic
bug. This fixes the bug while also maintaining the functionality to omit
log bind mounts when the variable `default_bind_mount_logs` is set to
"false".

Closes-Bug: #1632818
Change-Id: If9433d6280a3940c25fc0af714313d2caa265df6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add new project hurricane

This project will be a one-stop-shop for interconnecting
stackstorm and openstack and providing packs, tools and
integrated scripts and templates (and more) that allow for
stackstorm and openstack to integrate nicely (in a way that
also helps operators get the most bang for the buck).

LP @ https://launchpad.net/hurricane

What stackstorm is:

https://stackstorm.com/

Change-Id: I294bab81015f906fa5dd4579969552cbfc2733e6

craton-dashboard set to non-voting py35 and JS jobs

while a PyPi package of the craton client is released

commit_message:
Add new specs repo for valence project

Current didn't enable openstack-specs-jobs to facilitate start from
empty repo. Since renaming rsc -> valence is still pending for gerrit
downtime, still link core group to rsc-core.

Change-Id: Ic54ad6981495b16aa4e1d3d36cb2cb220479ba68

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Panko. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Panko.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Aodh, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ifa9dad55cfedeb8b804d675d3d4856af6096b039
Closes-Bug: #1590608
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/panko refs/changes/57/384357/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pipeline = cors http_proxy_to_wsgi request_id authtoken api-server [filter:http_proxy_to_wsgi] paste.filter_factory = oslo_middleware.http_proxy_to_wsgi:HTTPProxyToWSGI.factory oslo_config_project = panko

commit_message:
Add ceilometor, aodh and networing-sfc plugins

Since Newton release, Tacker supports vnffg and alarm-monitor features,
which need these above projects to run.

Enable these projects in integration test env to support the related
functional tests.

Change-Id: I141128d8d1079d61820b48a5dde4af24a6ee4654

commit_message:
Trap the proper exception when the client does not exist

The client was correctly removed from tempest and this exception surfaces.
Most likely ArgsAlreadyParsedError is not really needed, but let's keep it
for now.

Depends-On: I1afae0d1f9c4a6aec2742aaba4928cdde54b224f
Change-Id: I246120926726317691da84ab8b18c3d3fcba58a9

commit_message:
Remove netaddr code from sg_app

sg_app had a lot of code which could have been implemented using netaddr
library. This change changes the implementation to use netaddr, rather
than implementing it ourselves.

Change-Id: Ic5361bfe0bf4c1d1cf95592db8a5ee8b89f58448

subject: Ensure GetLastError gets called in the right thread
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-12 10:26:30.000000000', 'files': ['os_win/tests/utils/test_win32utils.py', 'os_win/utils/win32utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-win/commit/83aa222cd079d91198051566e9cf2daf524c32b4', 'message': "Ensure GetLastError gets called in the right thread

Recently, we've started invoking Win32 API functions in different
threads in order to avoid blocking other greenthreads.

The only issue is that if a function fails, we're retrieving the
error code by calling GetLastError from the original thread, thus
retrieving wrong error codes.

This change ensures that the subsequent error handling will be
performed in the same thread as the invoked function.

Change-Id: Id54b5bdb8e4561aaa42164b8c5d52a1a83da7149
Closes-Bug: #1632297
(cherry picked from commit b9d5d0b18b2492a5a4d43f3a7c2754c6d0e20429)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure GetLastError gets called in the right thread

Recently, we've started invoking Win32 API functions in different
threads in order to avoid blocking other greenthreads.

The only issue is that if a function fails, we're retrieving the
error code by calling GetLastError from the original thread, thus
retrieving wrong error codes.

This change ensures that the subsequent error handling will be
performed in the same thread as the invoked function.

Change-Id: Id54b5bdb8e4561aaa42164b8c5d52a1a83da7149
Closes-Bug: #1632297
(cherry picked from commit b9d5d0b18b2492a5a4d43f3a7c2754c6d0e20429)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-win refs/changes/83/385383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def run_and_check_output(self, *args, **kwargs): eventlet_nonblocking_mode = kwargs.pop( 'eventlet_nonblocking_mode', True) if eventlet_nonblocking_mode: # We have to make sure that the invoked function as well as the # subsequent error handling are performed within the same thread. return _utils.avoid_blocking_call( self._run_and_check_output, *args, **kwargs) else: return self._run_and_check_output(*args, **kwargs) def _run_and_check_output(self, func, *args, **kwargs): ret_val = func(*args, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: def run_and_check_output(self, func, *args, **kwargs): eventlet_nonblocking_mode = kwargs.pop( 'eventlet_nonblocking_mode', True) if eventlet_nonblocking_mode: ret_val = _utils.avoid_blocking_call(func, *args, **kwargs) else: ret_val = func(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Add option to enable Gnocchi's SSL middleware

Gnocchi is now using the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware from
oslo.middlware in its default api-paste configuration [1]. This commit
gives us the ability to enable/disable that middlware.

[1] Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129

Change-Id: Iae5f9d56970ae930294eeae34928061a6b434095
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-gnocchi refs/changes/58/384358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[admin-guide] Correct the output of "nova secgroup-list"

When run "nova secgroup-list" command,the output should contain the
"id" of security group,this patch fix it.

Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command

Change-Id: Ic5044c48a3679206e3a7e96d01ab16efecebf181

commit_message:
[Install Guide] fix LVM configuration

LVM must be configured in [lvm] section, not in [DEFAULT] section.
Clarify user must create [lvm] section if it does not exist.

Change-Id: I81dd41183fcf5ac60a231e6a002923e3af83f288
Closes-bug: 1632565
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/38/385338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * In the ``[lvm]`` section, configure the LVM back end with the and appropriate iSCSI service. If the ``[lvm]`` section does not exist, create it: [lvm]
deleted_lines: * In the ``[DEFAULT]`` section, configure the LVM back end with the and appropriate iSCSI service: [DEFAULT] ...

commit_message:
Fix old.fuellib_review_syntax_check fails for cobbler and nailgun

A latest puppet-lint version installed on CI server is used to
run old.fuellib_review_syntax_check for cobbler and nailgun
modules. As a result, we are checking stable code against latest
linting rules and getting new errors.

I have pinned puppet-lint version for rake lint checks for cobbler
and nailgun modules to fix current problem with dash checks.

Change-Id: Ida8e65a6ab64083b6f7bb4bd7db00618ffda9d57
Partial-bug: #1629859

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 06:09:35.000000000', 'files': ['etc/gnocchi/api-paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/67cdbb737ae8438a535640ebefecdaaa0bcbfe63', 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 2b1ed8d4528df8c3071343d1cd5764b6a7122fd1)
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608
(cherry picked from commit 2b1ed8d4528df8c3071343d1cd5764b6a7122fd1)

Newton apparmor fixes

In newton neutron-lbaas-agent has been renamed neutron-lbaasv2-agent.
The apparmor profile and resource map requires updates to handle this.

commit_message:
Configure Calico specific BIRD settings in OSA

In an effort to decouple the upstream BIRD role from Calico's specific
use-case, the role no longer configures BGP peers by default as of tag
1.1. We should insert some example BGP peers into the group vars so that
a deployer using Calico will receive some base BGP peer configuration
in their hypervisors.

This is essentially deploying the same configuration that was already
being deployed to BIRD, however the Calico specific defaults will now
reside in OSA.

Backport of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/385573/

Change-Id: Ic0ece84f259d0e72f79fedbd8a90fcc691f03229
(cherry picked from commit 0b164143691be4b8403b198f575d617ac01f7b3a)

commit_message:
Update amulet test definitions for Newton

- Remove Precise-Icehouse Amulet test definitions if they exist.

- Add Xenial-Newton Amulet test definitions.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions.

- Use the percona-cluster charm in tests instead of the mysql charm.

Change-Id: Idab48a7831008c5353eeb56da5deb49ce1305a41

commit_message:
Update amulet test definitions for Newton

- Remove Precise-Icehouse Amulet test definitions if they exist.

- Add Xenial-Newton Amulet test definitions, using ODL BE.

- Add Yakkety-Newton Amulet test definitions, using ODL BE.

- Use the percona-cluster charm in tests instead of the mysql charm.

- Also adjust py hash bangs to use env python.

Closes-Bug: 1632533

Change-Id: If10e49a9c45bc7fcd1eb073dcdccabed6c37a958
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-odl-controller refs/changes/31/375031/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/python # # Copyright 2016 Canonical Ltd # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); # you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. # You may obtain a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, # WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. # See the License for the specific language governing permissions and # limitations under the License. """Amulet tests on a basic odl controller deployment on xenial-newton.""" from basic_deployment import ODLControllerBasicDeployment if __name__ == '__main__': deployment = ODLControllerBasicDeployment(series='xenial', openstack='cloud:xenial-newton', source='cloud:xenial-updates/newton') deployment.run_tests()

commit_message:
[Testing] Make the port name to include bridge name

This patch is used only as part of the testing process.
Not for production.

Change-Id: I2de4010b4f62a2bb774618a25ffc1b698e35fd54
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/35/370635/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re short_bridge = re.sub(r'^[a-zA-Z\-]+', r'', self.integration_bridge) short_chassis = re.sub(r'^[a-zA-Z\-]+', r'', self.chassis.get_id()) port_name = "df-" + short_bridge + "-" + short_chassis

commit_message:
Fix Redis write failure after HA failover

when there is multi neutron worker ,redis can not write
after redis db cluster master node failed over

Change-Id: Icc55f87ede0f751ab1edbf664ed98b240dff9595
Closes-bug: #1609604

commit_message:
Add docs for PCI-DSS

This commit provides documentation for new security compliance features
and PCI-DSS.

Change-Id: I9261b7d632966faf68568edc59bece0f435df2e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/22/374422/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. ============================= Security Compliance & PCI-DSS ============================= As of the Newton release, keystone added new features around security compliance, specifically to satisfy Payment Card Industry - Data Security Standard (PCI-DSS) v3.1 requirements. However, these features could be used to satisfy other security requirements as well. See `Security Hardening: PCI-DSS <https://github.com/openstack/keystone-specs/blob/master/specs/keystone/newton/ pci-dss.rst#security-hardening-pci-dss>`_ for more information on PCI-DSS. These features can be enabled by changing the configuration settings under the ``[security_compliance]`` section in keystone.conf .. NOTE:: Most of these features only apply to the SQL backend for the identity driver. Disabling Inactive Users ------------------------ PCI-DSS 8.1.4 requires that inactive user accounts be removed or disabled within 90 days. You can achieve this by setting the ``disable_user_account_days_inactive``: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] disable_user_account_days_inactive = 90 This setting means, that users that have not authenticated (inactive) for the past 90 days will be automatically disabled. Users can be re-enabled by explicitly setting the enable user attribute via the API. Account Lockout Threshold ------------------------- The account lockout feature limits the number of times a user can attempt to login with an incorrect password. First, you can set the maximum number of failed authentication attempts by setting the ``lockout_failure_attempts``: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] lockout_failure_attempts = 6 You can then set the number of minutes a user would be locked out by setting the ``lockout_duration`` in seconds: .. code-block:: ini [security_compliance] lockout_duration = 1800 If the ``lockout_duration`` is not set, then users may be locked out indefinitely until the user is explicitly enabled via the API. Password Strength Requirements ------------------------------ Password History Requirements ------------------------------

commit_message:
Refactor router's code

Move some service related code from df-local-controller to l3 app.
By doing this, we want to make df-local-controller simpler and
unaware of details of service

Change-Id: I1e9a9541e6c445611396f5ac7409fd2e4069cbce

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_success

This replaces usage of mox with mock and also adds mocking of the
FixedIntervalLoopingCall in the test as there was a race on whether
or not _wait_for_snapshot and subsequently _volume_api.get_snapshot
would be called by the time the call assertion of get_snapshot
was made.

This was uncovered when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/315241/
replaced mox with mock in completely different tests and
test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_success began failing when run
in parallel with other tests. When run alone, it passed.

Part of blueprint remove-mox-newton


This is a series of original backports and their dependencies
for stable/mitaka for resolving the bug #1405533.

Required backports:
1) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329425/
2) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329422/

Backport dependencies:
1) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329421/
2) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329294/
3) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329287/
4) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/329280/

Change-Id: I4952f5cb3a3765ea0dee4a2a38483b6434d65ce6
(cherry picked from commit 4e5d6451378de58147ec8e2eb645c9edc416b5aa)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/329280/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('oslo_service.loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.' '_volume_snapshot_create') @mock.patch('nova.virt.libvirt.driver.LibvirtDriver.' '_volume_refresh_connection_info') def test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_success(self, mock_refresh, mock_snap_create, mock_loop): class FakeLoopingCall(object): def __init__(self, func): self.func = func def start(self, *a, **k): try: self.func() except loopingcall.LoopingCallDone: pass return self def wait(self): return None mock_loop.side_effect = FakeLoopingCall @mock.patch.object(self.drvr, '_volume_api') @mock.patch.object(self.drvr._host, 'get_guest') def _test(mock_get_guest, mock_vol_api): mock_get_guest.return_value = guest mock_vol_api.get_snapshot.return_value = {'status': 'available'} self.drvr.volume_snapshot_create(self.c, instance, self.volume_uuid, self.create_info) mock_get_guest.assert_called_once_with(instance) mock_snap_create.assert_called_once_with( self.c, instance, guest, self.volume_uuid, self.create_info['new_file']) mock_vol_api.update_snapshot_status.assert_called_once_with( self.c, self.create_info['snapshot_id'], 'creating') mock_vol_api.get_snapshot.assert_called_once_with( self.c, self.create_info['snapshot_id']) mock_refresh.assert_called_once_with( self.c, instance, self.volume_uuid) _test()
deleted_lines: def test_volume_snapshot_create_outer_success(self): self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.drvr._host, 'get_guest') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.drvr, '_volume_api') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.drvr, '_volume_snapshot_create') self.drvr._host.get_guest(instance).AndReturn(guest) self.drvr._volume_snapshot_create(self.c, instance, guest, self.volume_uuid, self.create_info['new_file']) self.drvr._volume_api.update_snapshot_status( self.c, self.create_info['snapshot_id'], 'creating') self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.drvr._volume_api, 'get_snapshot') self.drvr._volume_api.get_snapshot(self.c, self.create_info['snapshot_id']).AndReturn({'status': 'available'}) self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.drvr, '_volume_refresh_connection_info') self.drvr._volume_refresh_connection_info(self.c, instance, self.volume_uuid) self.mox.ReplayAll() self.drvr.volume_snapshot_create(self.c, instance, self.volume_uuid, self.create_info)

commit_message:
[Manila] Use only xenial nodes for newton+ branches

Remove 'ubuntu-trusty' jobs from usage with master and

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 06:17:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi/commit/9a740d1bb6b33e3ea7a491e311ab70d509b32489', 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi to api-paste

This sets up the HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware in front of Gnocchi. The
purpose of thise middleware is to set up the request URL correctly in
case there is a proxy (For instance, a loadbalancer such as HAProxy)
in front of Gnocchi.

So, for instance, when TLS connections are being terminated in the
proxy, and one tries to get the versions from the / resource of
Gnocchi, one will notice that the protocol is incorrect; It will show
'http' instead of 'https'. So this middleware handles such cases.
Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

The HTTPProxyToWSGI is off by default and needs to be enabled via a
configuration value.

Change-Id: Ic5526cf37e70335fa2cc70946a271253f227f129
Closes-Bug: #1590608

Thus helping Keystone discovery work correctly.

commit_message:
test: rewrite test_post_unix_timestamp in Gabbi

The test is actually poorly written as it uses a string rather than a
float. There's no reason that the test should pass, even if it does.

The real test that we need passing is a float, not a string parseable
with a float.

Change-Id: I6bf9df329e434bd477612780544813d1107b51c1

subject: Add http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware to Heat CFN endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-10 06:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['etc/heat/api-paste.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/6ad6ca33e73686437098c3eec3d35efec0dd03ac', 'message': "Add http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware to Heat CFN endpoint

This was already used in the API endpoint, but it's also needed in
the CFN endpoint. It's purpose is to process the X-Forwarded-Proto
header (or Proxy protocol if used) and set the protocol as directed
to https if done so. It's only needed if Heat is behind a TLS proxy
(such as HAProxy) and is also disabled by default.

Change-Id: Ibd81e1cf6bc1e3f63728b485e295478afa7f573c
Closes-Bug: #1590608
"}]
commit_message:
Add http_proxy_to_wsgi middleware to Heat CFN endpoint

This was already used in the API endpoint, but it's also needed in
the CFN endpoint. It's purpose is to process the X-Forwarded-Proto
header (or Proxy protocol if used) and set the protocol as directed
to https if done so. It's only needed if Heat is behind a TLS proxy
(such as HAProxy) and is also disabled by default.

Change-Id: Ibd81e1cf6bc1e3f63728b485e295478afa7f573c
Closes-Bug: #1590608

commit_message:
conf: Remove deprecated ``use_glance_v1``

Glance option ``use_glance_v1`` was deprecated and
listed as to be removed for Ocata. This patch removes it.

Blueprint centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: Id891172418535a88fefb8ea05d774fe39dc14eaf

python 2.7 (trusty and xenial), 3.4 (trusty) and 3.5(xenial).  The best

and have it sort out the freeze.

This is difficult as there isn't a trivial way to have all 3 versions of

commit_message:
Use --version-map when generating constraints updates

We need to generate constraints for all python versions we use.  This is
python 2.7 (trusty and xenial), 3.4 (trusty) and 3.5(xenial).  The best
way to do that is run generate-constraints with all 3 versions of python
and have it sort out the freeze.

This is difficult as there isn't a trivial way to have all 3 versions of
python available, and building from source on the proposal node is too
intrusive.

Use a --version-map that allows us to clone the output of a freeze
between python versions.  This assumes that the python version in
question are compatible during the transition window.

This will mean that we generate constraints consistently between
versions regardless of which version /usr/bin/python3 is.

Change-Id: I1a0122407a1edd8b828465780b3e7bd0d1b719d3
Depends-On: I55a3597ea2f2bf48e30dc564a4bf4b2ef7f178b3

commit_message:
Change the common proxy cache manage tasks to be stateful

In certain situation the proxy cache manager may be down, misconfigured,
or otherwise not available. To ensure a consistent environment and give
the deployer a better build experience, especially in the case of an
AIO, the proxy cache common task has been changed to test for cache
availability and add/remove the cache files based on that test.

Change-Id: Ibd0186d67a844ec7b79f423adfb8104d13f72ca5
Closes-Bug: #1632826
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update doc to have 'debootstrap' dep and describe minimal

Update the doc, that explains how to use disk-image-builder to create an
image, to have an additional dependency on 'debootstrap'

Also remove DISTRO= line from example as it was confusing and would make
people not build the ubuntu-minimal image.

Add a little info on the -minimal build types.

Change-Id: I8a7393a9c71ef503a730e4442941996eab43da6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/385715/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo apt-get install kpartx qemu-utils curl python-yaml debootstrap bash tools/build-image.sh See the script for environment variables to set distribution, etc. By default it builds an ubuntu-minimal based image. You should be left with a .qcow2 image file of your selected distribution. Infra uses the -minimal build type for building Ubuntu/CentOS/Fedora. For example: ubuntu-minimal.

commit_message:
Use Ml2PluginV2TestCase to test DFMechDriver

Ml2PluginV2TestCase was introduced to test revision_number. Actually
it could be used to test all cases of DFMechDriver. So df don't have
to fake everything for the UT.

Change-Id: I7e172d179bcf1ced24e9f1046a07c3850cceb813
Closes-bug: #1618738

commit_message:
Require osc-lib>=1.2.0

osc-lib 1.2.0 contains the fix for CVE bug 1630822
so that passwords will be masked from --debug output.

This raises the minimum required version so that
python-openstackclient picks up that fix.

Change-Id: Ia5c8c111d0829f87f8a4f69f429eabe581dd084c
Depends-On: Id3bcd7c3220a8307dfcaf3098d1c3ad3c605469d

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Cleanup of Initiator group fails

When the last volume has been deleted from the Storage
Group and the Masking View has been deleted and the
initiator group is no longer in use, the deletion of
the Initiator group fails. The initiator group is actually
deleted off the array, but the code is throwing up an
error when it uses the now deleted initiator group
name to search for remaining masking views. The
solution is to check if the initiator group has been
deleted by common.terminate_connection before searching
for remaining masking views.

Change-Id: I79559789459f73c4adebf010d84cbeedd25f7f74
Closes-Bug: #1605193
(cherry picked from commit 8e62557f6e6608ab415d5d172caa88f3033a86a0)

commit_message:
Objects: Add README for neutron/objects directory tree

As we have started oslo.versionedobjects implementation (OVO),
there are lots of Objects that need implementation. This README
in the root dir will give some guidance to keep the tree organized.

Change-Id: I9253a243f37e4695290162bee7a41149c5f665fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/352577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =============== Neutron Objects =============== Directory ========= This directory is designed to contain all Neutron Objects shipped with core Neutron. The directory should follow the guidlines below Structure --------- The Neutron objects tree should have the following structure:: objects/ |---__init__.py |---base.py |---<any common/base classes> |---networks/ <--- For Example |---__init__.py |---network.py <--- Core Subnet Object Implementation |---extensions/ <--- Any extensions to Network object |---__init__.py |---mtu.py |---port_security.py |---subnets/ |---__init__.py |---subnet.py |---extensions/ |---__init__.py

commit_message:
Throttle update_auditor_status calls

If there are quite a few nearly empty partitions per disk you might see
some write load even if your cluster is unused. The auditor will update
the status file after every partition, and this might happen multiple
times within a second if there is not much data stored yet.

This patch throttles updates, and will only write out an updated status
if the file was last updated more than a minute ago.

Closes-Bug: 1631352
Change-Id: Ib61ec9cd945e6b2d28756f6ca47801674a7e6060

commit_message:
Updating the document regarding LDAP options

Closes-bug: #1274581

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/34/379334/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. NOTE:: The /etc/ldap/ldap.conf file is read if it exists and then keystone.conf is read as a back up. But that could confuse admins. If the value of 'tls_cacertfile' is set to 'system', then the /etc/ldap/ldap.conf is parsed otherwise the file specifed by tls_cacertfile is used.
